intro: Balsamocitrus gabonensis, commonly known as the Gabon balsam, is a flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in moist, forested areas and can thrive in a variety of soil types. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
